title: Add heuristics for automatically identifying and associating correct form fields
body: Right now, in order for Card to work, the developer has to manually add selectors for the necessary form fields. While this should be encouraged, it would nice if Card jut worked out of the box most of the time.

title: Add support for name field
Add better error and valid markers to Card fields
Radial gradients are broken in Safari
body: Safari chokes on the radial gradients with super high transparency. For now, I've disabled them by checking user agent and disabling for Safari, but I'd like to find a way to make them work.

title: American Express security code is in front. Check for card type and don't flip it if it's AMEX
body: BTW This is great work! Love it!

title: Update README.md
Add to bower
body: Adding this to bower would make it a lot more easily usable.

title: Tab key broken in month/year field
body:
Expected: pressing tab in `MM/YY` field switches focus to `CVC` field.

Actual: does nothing.

(Note: this is based on the demo implementation on http://jessepollak.github.io/card/)

title: Font colour on unrecognized card type
body:
You might want to change the colour of the font for better contrast when it can't recognize the card type.

Ie. if I type in a random number just to see how it works, I can barely see what I'm typing in on the card due to the lack of contrast.

title: Doesn't handle long cardholder names well
body: Perhaps it can evaluate how many characters are in the field and change font size (smaller) as it gets longer and longer.

title: Auto fill by browsers does not trigger re-render
body:
Using the arrow keys to select an existing entry in the form history then pressing tab to select it and continue to the next input field does not update the visual display.

Firefox 29 on OS 10.9

title: Let me type "inside" the card as an option
body: Example: http://kenkeiter.com/skeuocard/

title: Cannot turn formatting off in the options
body:
It seems that the default formatting setting (true) overwrites whatever you add in.  

I think it's because of line (547)

this.options = $.extend({}, opts, this.defaults);

I think you want to swap the user options to after your provided defaults so they override.

I'll make a quick PR with the change

title: Allow user override of default options
body:
See http://api.jquery.com/jquery.extend/ -- Basically the user provided options should be the last arg of the extend call so they "win"

Closes #13 if marged

title: Missing front view
Add better support for long names
body:
Changes the position property and adds a width limit to names. This way, long names grow upwards. Supports 2 lines just fine.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/62244/3182388/2787f33a-ec51-11e3-8cf3-3d58e036ccab.png)

title: add npm start command and update gulp to 3.7.0
body:
* add `npm start` command
* update `gulp` to 3.7.0 which support `gulpfile.coffee` directly

cc @jessepollak

title: Add additional card types
body:
I'm not sure how many cards this affects, but here's an example:

Type in 62 into the card entry. It should be UnionPay. It's nothing. Try 622. It should be Discover. Nothing.

Furthermore, 622 is not a Discover card prefix, it's a UnionPay prefix. The program is missing a few card numbers as well.

See: [the Wikipedia page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bank_card_number#Issuer_identification_number_.28IIN.29)

title: user supplied options should overwrite defaults
body:
See http://api.jquery.com/jquery.extend/ -- Basically the user provided options should be the last arg of the extend call so they "win"

Closes #13 if marged

title: Auto fill by browsers does not trigger re-render
body:
Hi

Really like what you have done here, I was trying out the demo and it doesn't pick up an auto fill from chrome on my name. 

The card image does not update. 

Thanks

Paul

title: Minor code cleanup
Allow translations
body:
This plugin is great but it would be even better if you could allow to pass translations through additional files as in jquery-validation : https://github.com/jzaefferer/jquery-validation/tree/master/src/localization

I'll be more than happy to contribute by translating the captions into French.

title: Remove jQuery dependence and offer a jQuery plugin in addition to normal library
body:
I'm not sure this nice lib really require jquery.
It seems a good option to make something jquery free, then make available a jquery plugin (eg: [Pikaday](https://github.com/dbushell/Pikaday) do that).

title: Update README.md
body: Just a teeny tiny typo I noticed.

title: Implement name length checks and year validation
body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2203377/3188308/8a008e24-ecb9-11e3-9e90-554473578a4e.png)

The Name field doesn't appear to have any length checks. The MM/YY field accepts 13 to 19 as a valid month, and up to 9999 as a valid year. It also accepts years less than the current year.

title: Corners 'unround' for a moment after recognising a card
body:
It's kind of jarring from a aesthetic point of view.

The right-hand side of the card's background also moves after the card finishes fading in.

title: Fix #26
body: This fixes both problems within the issue.

title: Compiled CSS oddities
body:
See: https://github.com/jessepollak/card/blob/master/lib/css/card.css#L407

This line has one linear-gradient with a `-webkit-` prefix despite the rest not having the prefix.

Also I have no idea why the `background-image`s are repeated twice each. The single difference is in the sheen on the top left. The top one has a degree of 245 and the other has -115, functionally identical in every way.

I'm not used to scss, so I couldn't find the issue at hand.

title: Card should handle `value` values correctly in initial rendering
body:
When the form is partially pre-filled with address data, it should display this on the card.

I can't figure out how to get it take the pre-fill data and use it, tabbing around the form causes the image to update, but triggering clicks, focus, change, etc does not. Also, it only updates the image with pre-fill data from a field you tab into focus, not tabbing out (blur).

What's the easiest way to update the image with data place in the form from the DB?

title: Support for ASP.net Web Forms
body:
This this is awesome, great work.

I cannot get the plugin to work with ASP.net web forms.  I believe it has something to do with having the form tag on every page and not just around the form itself.

title: Add "npm run build"
body: Now, `npm run build` will build the app in production mode.

title: Add better error messages for missing inputs
body:
Right now, if your form doesn't contain the correct inputs (or you select the wrong form), you're just going to get a JS `undefined` error. For less technical users, it would be helpful to explicitly warn when certain inputs are missing.

This would help with solves #30.

title: Slide up card rather than showing at the start
body:
Many users get confused by the card and aren't sure where to type - in the form or on the card. 

Having an option to slide the card up and into view will alleviate some of this.

title: Exclude Card Types
body: Does this project allow for excluding card types? Let's say I have a company that only accepts Visa and MasterCard and NO Amex. Can I prevent Amex cards from showing the graphics?

title: Default value set to card render
body:
I'm having the issue that after the form is ran and there are validation errors the card render is back to it's blank state while the form still displays input in the fields.

I'd like for the card to be able to render on load with default values.

title: Allow rendered expiry year format to be configured (mm/yyyy vs. mm/yy)
body:
If would be great if when a form uses the format "mm/yyyy" for an expiry date, it could be displayed as four dots on the card.

I would do this myself, but haven't got time to learn coffeescript right now. :)

title: Card not rendered when using paste
body: When I paste a card number into the form and use only the mouse (no keyboard events) the card is not rendered correctly. No numbers appear on the card graphic however formatting is done to the pasted value.

title: SSL
body:
Whilst I appreciate this is a demo - the SSL/HTTP link is more preferable. Just incase. It's highly unlikely anyone would be entering sensitive data. But I've seen stranger things:

https://jessepollak.github.io/card/

title: Fixed name overflow
body: Fixed Name field overflow by adding ellipsis (#25)
